results.title: Swing time
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and George Stevens
results.brief_description: Swing time was the sixth film made by Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers together. The story is slight, but quite delightful, bringing Fred and Ginger together, then keeping them apart until the last time we hear “A fine romance”. Astaire plays a dancer out of work, and Rogers is a dancing teacher - he pretends that he cannot dance so that he may be taught by Rogers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and George Stevens

results.title: Swing shift
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bick, Lantana, Warner Bros Pictures and Jonathan Demme
results.brief_description: Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell star in this vivid look back at the wartime conditions that stood society on its head - and a sensitive, romantic story of the good times and the bad times a whole generation of Americans will never forget. The movie stays at home and follows the stories of men and women working in the factories that produce weaponry for the battles overseas, all produced predominantly by the round-the-clock efforts of over 3 million female workers. Many, like Hawn’s character Kay Walsh, have never held a wrench before - but you’re never too pretty to learn. Christine Lahti, co-starring as Kay’s sultry neighbour, Hazel, proves that even a dance-hall singer can handle a rivet gun. Russell plays Lucky Lockhart, the 4-F classified trumpet player who’d rather be handling real guns - until he falls in love with Kay. Kays’ husband Jack (Ed Harris) comes home on leave and finds out that his wife has betrayed him. Lucky then decides to pursue Hazel, driving a wedge between the two friends.

results.title: Swing Fitness for Older Adults
results.brief_description: This gentle, all new, swing movement video is designed specifically for the young at heart (30-80 years) who wish to keep supple, healthy and full of life with a minimum of effort and a maximum amount of enjoyment. If you are ready to begin exercising in the safest way possible, you are ready for this remarkable program.

results.title: Swing away
results.creator_credit: Castle Films, United World Films and Max Glandbard
results.brief_description: Golfer Tommy Armour demonstrates the importance of coordinated balance, rhythm, and timing in the backswing and the downswing. Shows the advantage of the closed stance for the drive and other long wood shots and of the square stance for long iron shots. Discusses the specific uses of various golf clubs. Includes demonstrations in slow motion photography.

results.title: Swing and sing
results.brief_description: A collection of big band jazz music with classic songs “The Boogie Woogieman”, “Dancing on air” and “Fantasia” which eventually set the popular tunes and rhythms in 1950s United States. Featuring Will Osborne and his Orchestra, Martha Tilton - Brian Sisters and the Aida Broadbent Dancers.

results.title: Swing (Gatlif)
results.creator_credit: Princes Films, Nathalie Duran, Laurent Dusothoit and Tony Gatlif
results.brief_description: Gatlif’s passion for Gypsies and their music continues as a theme in this his fourth feature film. A young French boy Max discovers Gypsy music and lifestyle whilst on summer holidays with his grandmother. He takes guitar lessons from a master player of Manouche Jazz in return for reading and writing letters to Social Security on his teacher’s behalf. During lessons he begins to fain headaches to spend more time with the beautiful gypsy tomboy ‘Swing’. Swing teaches Max, who is from the wealthy side of the river, about nature and brings him to some wild musical evenings at the caravans.

results.title: Swimmy
results.creator_credit: Connecticut Films, Leo Lionni and Giulio Gianini
results.brief_description: This prize-winning animated film is Leo Lionni’s own interpretation of his original fable about the small fish, Swimmy, which outwits the hungry tuna and leads the other fish in exploring the marvellous underwater world.

results.title: Swimming with sharks = The Buddy factor [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Keystone Partners, Steve Alexander, Joanne Moore and George Huang
results.brief_description: When Guy, a recent film-school graduate with big ideas, takes a job as assistant to major studio executive, Buddy Ackerman, he believes his ship has finally come in. Little does he know, however, that it is a slave ship, for his boss is indeed worse than a slave driver, delighting in abusing his new toy-boy. Guy struggles to push his idea for a script and feels he’s finally made it when Buddy congratulates him on a job well done. However, much to his chagrin, his conniving boss actually takes sole credit for the project, pushing Guy to his wit’s end. He breaks into Buddy’s Beverly Hills home and takes him hostage, then proceeds to torture him in a number of demeaning and horrifying ways. Cast includes: Kevin Spacey, Frank Whaley, Michelle Forbes, Benicio del Toro and Jerry Levine.
